newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan's CB foreign assets fall seven pct in Jan.
newsitem.headline: Jordan's CB foreign assets fall seven pct in Jan.

text.p: The Central Bank of Jordan's total foreign assets fell 7.5 percent in January to 2.086 billion dinars ($2.95 billion) from 2.254 billion dinars in December, the bank's monthly bulletin said.
(*) includes a compulsory reserve requirement imposed on foreign currency deposits held by Jordanian banks. New regulations issued in late October cut the requirement to 14 percent from 35 percent.

The bank's figures do not provide a breakdown that shows the country's absolute net foreign currency cash reserves -- currently around two months imports levels and close to the IMF target of $620 million for 1996.
